(1997) | }} '''''Diamond Music''''' is a 1996 [[album]] by [[Wales|Welsh]] [[composer]] [[Karl Jenkins]]. Perhaps one of Jenkins most recognized works is the first movement of the "Palladio" suite, inspired by 16th-century architect [[Andrea Palladio]] and in the style of a ''[[concerto grosso]]''. This piece, in varying [[arrangement]]s, has served as the music for [[DeBeers]] [[television advertisement]]s since the company's "Shadows and Light" campaign in the mid-1990s. For this reason, the album is titled ''Diamond Music'' and the cover art features shadowed figures and photographs of diamonds much like the imagery used in the ad campaign. Jenkin's compositions in this album encompass a broad [[Polystylism|polystylistic]] range, contrasting delicate pieces written for [[string quartet]] with the broad sound of a [[string orchestra]]. "String Quartet No. 2" includes movements in the [[Baroque music|Baroque]] style of [[Antonio Vivaldi]] ("The Fifth Season") as well as a [[Tango (dance)|tango]], [[waltz]], [[hoedown]], and others. The four "Adiemus [[Variation (music)|Variations]]" are reworkings of Jenkins' own piece "Adiemus" from ''[[Adiemus: Songs of Sanctuary]]''. Additionally, the second movement of "Palladio" served as the theme for "Cantus Insolitus" also heard on ''Songs of Sanctuary''. ==Track listing== #"Palladio I, Allegretto" â 3:47 #"Palladio II, Largo" â 5:38 #"Palladio III, Vivace" â 6:58 #"Adiemus Variations I" â 1:28 #"Adiemus Variations II" â 3:32 #"Adiemus Variations III" â 2:29 #"Adiemus Variations IV" â 3:33 #"Passacaglia" â 4:53 #"String Quartet No. 2: I The Fifth Season" â 3:43 #"String Quartet No. 2: II Tango" â 5:50 #"String Quartet No. 2: III Waltz" â 2:11 #"String Quartet No. 2: IV Romanze" â 2:59 #"String Quartet No. 2: V Bits" â 4:44 ==Personnel== *[[London Philharmonic Orchestra|London Philharmonic Strings]] *The [[Smith Quartet]] == Other arrangements == ''Diamond Music'' is the title of a track by solo [[pianist]] [[Tim Neumark]]. The piece is a solo piano rendition of the first movement of Jenkins' "Palladio" suite. The British electric string quartet [[bond (band)|Bond]] performed a rendition of "Palladio", titled "Allegretto", on their ''[[Shine (bond album)|Shine]]'' album. A second British electric string quartet, [[Escala (group)|Escala]] also performed a similar arrangement of the piece on their [[Escala (album)|self-titled album]]. Also this piece is well known as being the theme music for famous singer, [[Jade Villalon]] of [[Sweetbox]]'s song "Sorry". Jedi Mind Tricks song "On the Eve of War" samples the first movement of Jenkin's "Palladio Suite" The "Theme from Palladio" was also performed by [[Carol Williams (organist)|Carol Williams]] on the organ of St Martin's church in Dudelange, Luxembourg. Recently, an episode of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (U.S. TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]'' featured ''Palladio'' performed.
